job_title: Veterinary Technician, RVT in Lafayette, IN
pros: Lots of opportunity to learn, then go work where you’re appreciated.
cons: Certain depts have a high turnover due to poor treatment by management.  They do not seem to value RVTs as individuals, but as mere “help”.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Excellent research institution with plenty of resources, ranging from team of lawyer to patent/copyright your research work to newly renovate recreational center. Professor, grad students, and staff are very helpful.
cons: The role of thesis advisor(s) is very important. Do not overlook the uncomfortable encounters and working style. These often times lead to less desirable outcome or bigger problem after the first year. If you are a PHD student be prepare for the last year of thesis, most people work >10hrs everyday including weekend.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Working at Purdue for over 6 years as a graduate research assistant. Personally, my experience has been rewarding thanks to my adviser.
cons: Location is isolated leaving very little to do come downtime. The weather is not very helpful as well. Snows close to 6 months in a year and summers can get harsh as well.

job_title: in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Job Security great place for individuals that strive to simply get by in life. No drug tests or background checks required for most position. Great place to work. Faculty has life time job security.
cons:
Mediocre performance is rewarded.
Tuition Assistance policy is horrible for a premier research institution.
Compensation practices are horrible. Compensation is based on date of hire not experience. I could have more experience than someone working in my department but get paid less based on date of hire.
Reduced benefits and flat salary with no expectation of an increase.
This place doesn't place value on diversity.

review_title: Teaching while in my Master's program was a great learning experience and income resource.
job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Fort Wayne, IN
pros: The environment of the department I was a part of continuously shows they're care for the people around them. Teaching in this department was not only beneficial to my learning experience, it also helped me form connections with professors and other colleagues.
cons: Graduate teaching is only temporary and part time pay. It also requires a lot of time to grade papers, create syllabi, and prepare class discussions. However, they experience is worth having.

review_title: Growing school which should evade the Higher Ed. Bubble
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in West Lafayette, IN
pros:
State of the art research opportunities and excellent reputation in industry.
Near graduation all of my classmates received great offers from companies in the semiconductor industry.
cons: Low salary, long hours, bad location. Generally the same cons as all graduate schools.  The location makes it easy to focus on work but doesn't provide many unique opportunities for recreation. Even the bar scene is muted for a big 10 school.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Large school, lots of resources, active graduate student government.  Highly dependent on your primary adviser.  Lots of open space and relatively safe
cons: Far from urban life, limited entertainment options.  School can provide lots of red tape and can be frustrating to work through at times.

review_title: Leading edge research in a quiet, midwestern environment
job_title: Anonymous Employee in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Focus on engineering provides a strong base for research projects.  Lots of talented faculty members with a willingness to work on interdisciplinary projects.  Emphasis on creativity and a growing base of entrepreneurial support for commercializing ideas.  Flexible work hours, good vacation and leave policies.  Great place to raise a family.
cons: Not a great place for young professionals looking to have fun outside of work.  Promotion policies are unclear and uneven (like many other universities).

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Indianapolis, IN
pros: Great School with lots of opportunities and great faculty.  It is a challenging school that prepares its students for the future in this changing world
cons: The school is very difficult.  If you are unorganized or not disciplined, you will not survive very long as this institution.  Put the work in and you will benefit.

job_title: in Lafayette, IN
pros: Good working environment and you can learn a lot from it. The pay is very high comparing to other student job (different department may have different salary)
cons: Some professors may want you to do most of the job, and this will make you feel very tired. If you gonna be a lab instructor, you will spend most of the time on homework grading.

review_title: Great advisor and mentor. Too much politics.
job_title: Research Scientist in Lafayette, IN
pros: Great pool of students. Very talented faculties. Collaborative environment. Much opportunities for research. Great support for grant writing. Travel and other funding available.
cons: Hard work and talent is not always rewarded. University often does not recognize the extra effort or competence. Rather it pays more based on the experience, i.e., just how many years the person is in the company. That creates a bad culture.

job_title: Project Manager in West Lafayette, IN
pros: The flexibility of working at a university, allows for individual work life balance, whatever that is. Because of the slow arduos screening and lack of ability to source candidates projects take a long time to complete besides everything else that you need to deal with.
cons: Slow HR system that isn't up to date and hard to work with

review_title: If I had it to do all over again I would not have worked so long at Purdue.
job_title: Custodian, Third Shift in West Lafayette, IN
pros: The benefits are very good.
cons: From what I've seen, hiring and promotions, transfers and pay increases are based solidly in a good old boy system. Job knowledge and proficiency is secondary. Management isn't above breaking the University's stated code of conduct where these points are concerned.

review_title: Nice place to work, grow and get experience.
job_title: Lab Operations Coordinator in Hammond, IN
pros: Friendly coworkers, a commitment to providing excellent education and labs for students, department management pushes for more resources in a tough budget climate, ability to work creatively
cons: Out of date facilities make setting up for labs difficult.  Students complain that the department isn't committed to their education when in reality, they have no control over the out of date building.  Bad air quality, mold growth etc... Don't work here if you have allergies.

review_title: Graduate research assistant at Material deparment
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Good laboratories, although small department it is pretty active and you can feel they are trying to expand and grow. Faculties have good connections with some industries and people recognize Purdue name on conferences and other events. Companies come to the department asking for students.
cons: There are many faculties looking to publish and don't pay close attention to student's development, future carreer. Most of faculties try to talk you into academia and out of industry.

job_title: Student Worker in West Lafayette, IN
pros:
1. My boss is smart, talented, and a great leader 
2. My colleagues are truly passionate about their work
3. Learning opportunities are everywhere
4. Growth both personally and professionally 
5. Two words: TUITION REMISSION
cons:
1. Lower pay 
2. Communication btwn depts can suffer due to large size 
3. Sometimes conservative 
4. Not in a larger city

job_title: Web Developer in West Lafayette, IN
pros: I am a student and it is very convenient to have the office right on campus. My co-workers and supervisor are super friendly and provide a fun work environment.
cons: There are many departments and offices that compromise the university and communication between them when working on a cooperative project can be hard at times.

review_title: A good place to do research
job_title: Research Associate in West Lafayette, IN
pros: A lot of outstanding professors and staff.  the working environment is great. the people are very friendly and easy to deal with.
cons: life is boring due to the geological location.  If you are a kindof person who wanna live in big cities with a lot of night life, this is not a place for you.

job_title: Account Coordinator in Hammond, IN
pros: It used to be a convenient spot to travel to before they moved everyone around.  Also, if you are right on campus, the police are good.
cons: There is no respect for your fellow employee.  No courtesy, no nothing.  They treat you like you are nothing.  I ate lunch at my desk just to catch up on my work, no one ever appreciated it.  I have never worked at such an uncaring place.

review_title: Quiet place for research work but less industrial opportunities
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in West Lafayette, IN
pros: As a good place for academic research work, Purdue is high standard and comfortable. The work time depends on the 'boss''s requirement but quite flexible. Colleagues are nice and collaborative. Pay is good according to low life expense in West Lafayette.
cons: Far less opportunities for students to get involved into particular industrial practices in big companies than those in big cities, unless you are majoring in Agriculture or Mechanical/Manufacturing (CAT, Subaru, and ranches in town) .

review_title: Good for people who want flexibility in schedules and work environment
job_title: IT Management in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Lots of work-life balance.  Very flexible.  VERY CONSERVATIVE.  People who love educating would be proud to work here.
cons: Very conservative HR and Overall policies.  compensation in IT is lower than most places.  Staff (non-faculty) seem to be undervalued under current president.  Very difficult to keep morale up for long periods of time.

job_title: Student Associate in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Good environment, quite place to work. People around are so nice and good chance to know people from around the world and be multicutural
cons: Salary is not considered high, but fair enough for people living in Indiana. Also, as Purdue University locates in a small town far away from cities such as Chicago and Indianapolis, activities after work and study could be limited. It will be tricky for people living in town to adjust themselves between working/studying and R&R

job_title: Assistant Director for High School Consortiums in Westville, IN
pros: The job started out with very good benefits, 20 days of vacation and comp time, lots of sick leave.  The people in administrative positions are very good to work with.
cons: Hours were long because there are not enough people to perform all tasks needed.  Constantly staying late to finish work that could have been done by another employee

job_title: Front Office Coordinator in New Albany, OH
pros: Extremely flexible and the management staff was absolutely astounding.
cons: Although being the only black male in the office and being the most respectful and highest paid among  the other student I was accused of stealing from the office and was escorted to the police station to be questioned. It was later found that the money that was stolen as found inside the cash register. There were 2 detectives and it only took 1 management staff to find the money.

review_title: Average benefits, typical academic culture, political.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Hammond, IN
pros: Decent benefits like major medical and such but also the tuition break for the employee and their family. Friendly environment.
cons: Political culture, even if you're not in the educational rank and file structure.

review_title: Great jobs for students--not so for career-minded employees
job_title: IT Project Manager in Lafayette, IN
pros: Colleagues are generally helpful. Employees are very dedicated in helping students succeed.
cons: If you are coming from corporate, the University is about 10-15 years behind in almost every area. This is an educational organization but it doesn't develop its own employees. IF there is an annual pay increase, it is now around 2%--in 2020 no pay increase. Leadership does not model integrity. People are chosen for leadership positions without posting the jobs.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Exposure and the knowledge of the people around. You get to work on some excellent projects depending on your professor. If one is interested in a field, then I guess purdue is a great place for graduate degrees.
cons: Pressure - totally depends on your professor though. Funding within the department has been a problem to many new professors off late and doesn't look like getting better any time soon especially if you are in engineering and not in energy or bio-related field.

job_title: Graduate Student in West Lafayette, IN
pros: The pros of attending the graduate culture were the potential to collaborate with engineers, biologists and different chemists were second to none.
cons: The only cons of the graduate program were the slight difficulty in finding exactly who to look up when you need to have a problem solved.

review_title: Great place to work as an IT Student at Purdue Libraries Support
job_title: IT Desk Support Assistant in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Flexibility for students, great pay, and very applicable and valuable skills in IT-- overall an excellent first job for a technology major.
cons: Close to none-- Occasionally picking up some work when people were sick can become an issue in busy times, but you are always appreciated and the Windows Systems Admin who is in charge of overseeing the students is very supportive and helpful.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Flexibility in work-life balance. Ability to set strategy and execution plans. Good benefits and opportunities provided to employees, as well as their families.
cons: The pace at which thing get accomplished is slower than I would like. The amount of red tape is also very high when trying to impact change.

review_title: It's a good job if your spouse is going to graduate school at Purdue.
job_title: Contract Analyst in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Purdue is a great place if you a mother and have children.
cons: The culture is not the best, at least within the administrative side.  It is very difficult to go above-and-beyond the call of duty.  Some employees do not want to really work.  People just want to get the job done and go home.  They don't really take pride in their work.

review_title: Good steady work with great amenities.
job_title: Student Utility Worker in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Always meeting new people and working with RA's and other student workers who have a positive motivational attitude. Great benefits and amenities (dining halls, paid holidays, sick days, etc.).
cons: As with any position where you work within a group, conflict and negative relationships can arise. Some of the work can get redundant and boring at times.

job_title: Programmer Analyst in West Lafayette, IN
pros: My manager, Dr. Cleveland Shields, was very reasonable and appreciative of my work.
cons: The only con I can think of is the time card process. I had to resubmit almost every time card I had, because I did complete it correctly. In the future, it would be nice to be corrected the first time so I only make the mistake once.

job_title: Graduate Aide in Crown Point, IN
pros: I enjoyed teaching the laboratory for the Surveying & GIS and Mechanics of Materials courses for the Civil Engineering students.  It was a good teaching experience, and it was a good review of the material personally.
cons: When I taught one of the labs, my supervisor was the one who would give me advice on how to best perform/teach the lab.  The downside was that my supervisor was late often, and it would cause stress for both of us.

job_title: Director in Hammond, IN
pros: Great institution to work, with amazing benefits and great contributions to 401K. This institution is in great transition with mergers and change!
cons: Institution culture is ridgid and change resistant. People have been employed in the same positions for entirely too long and makes it challenging to acquire and retain new talent

job_title: Student Supervisor in West Lafayette, IN
pros: I've loved working for Purdue. As a student, it's difficult to balance work, school, and a social life. Purdue allows me to enjoy all 3 with scheduled and flexible hours. The other students are fun to work with and it's a comfortable environment. Every semester is different because of new employees and recipes.
cons: At the Central Production Kitchen, we have to work Sundays which I would rather have off to relax or work on homework.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Excellent core instrumentation and friendly and collaborative researchers helped me get a significant amount of research done at Purdue during my graduate studies.
cons: Staff can be less than friendly and at times are unwilling to help facilitate research or employment issues which can be very frustrating at times.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Very flexible work hours, depending on the professor. Very laid back environment, steady income, not nearly as much pressure as in industry.
cons: Work hours actually vary from 5 hours a week to upwards of 80 hours a week. Professors sometimes forget you're actually there to go to school!

job_title: Research Assistant in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Strong research recourse. The university offers a generous Tuition Fee Remission for the employees and their spouses and children. have enough time to spend with family. Free for the facilities in Purdue’s Recreational Sports Center.
cons: University charges high tuition and increase by years. The policy to international students is strict. Poor career service and poor housing.

review_title: Great University with new President driving good direction.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Strong infrastructure to support graduate students through many departments. IT is excellent and responsive. Worldwide name recognition. Job placement after graduation is strong.
cons: Disconnect between many systems when different schools have duplicate systems. Housing support and transition assistance to students starting in December is non-existent.

job_title: Educational Technologist in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Benefits are great. Perks nice and good professional development opportunities.
cons: No way to move up, no salary accommodation for inflation. Whatever way you are hired is how you stay with salary.

job_title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant in West Lafayette, IN
pros:
-Easy and educational way to make some money while taking classes on campus.
-Build connections with other TAs and professors.
cons: -Not sure if this is exactly a con, but there are no definite hours, so you don't really know how much money you will make every week; it's based on how many hours you put in, so don't expect to make the same amount every week unless you work the same amount each week (which is unlikely).

job_title: Teaching Assistant in West Lafayette, IN
pros: decent salary, time off during the summer, teaching experience, part time hours, real world training for academics, working with other students
cons: teachers and professors may not respect you, you are sometimes expected to teach things without a good knowledge base, reviews can be unfair

review_title: Great and supportive staff embeds the values of the university.
job_title: Resident Assistant in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Great deal of diversity. Staff is knowledgable in a wide array of areas and topics. Great place to increase your network. There is a variety of support options and great compensation/benefits for the work done.
cons: There are minimal downsides. In my specific area, University Residences, there is often a lack of organization, but that is usually due to the dynamic and unpredictable nature of incidents that must be corrected.

job_title: Research Assistant in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Flexible working time, good benefit, health insurance, gym access, safe and quite environment. Very convenient  and free communication.
cons: Hash weather during weather during winter time. Low salary. Park space is not enough. A lost of offices and labs are located in the basement and subbasement.

job_title: Teaching Assistant in West Lafayette, IN
pros: You will have a great opportunities to learn and conduct research here. You can participate the international conference and present your research. Many seminar and famous researcher in your area will come to here.
cons: The weather is terrible. Most of the time you need work on your own. You need to be very aggressive to search opportunities.

job_title: in West Lafayette, IN
pros: very safe there. I like the environment and peaceful life. Also enjoy the research life here. The people are very nice.
cons: It is a little bit boring. i have been to boston before. It is a very nice place to go. I can take duck tour. Here I can do nothing but study.

job_title: in West Lafayette, IN
pros:
-Well known institution
-Affordable location
-Cutting edge of innovation in hard science and engineering
-Prepares you for other career opportunities
cons:
-Changing policies can lead to confusion between departments
-Academic atmosphere does not lend to an easy career/life division
-Liberal Arts are an afterthought
-Greater Lafayette area somewhat isolated geographically

job_title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant in West Lafayette, IN
pros:
Nice people to work with! Time is flexible. 
This work requires you to be very patient and be prepared to answer lots of questions in some entry level CS courses.
cons: Really low wage for undergraduate students, though they might have the same workload as the Graduate Teaching Assistants. CS offers the lowest wage among all the departments I know. Considering switching to another job next semester.

job_title: Extension Educator in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Flexible hours, lots of vacation time, good colleagues. Full time exempt staff get 21 vacation days per year. Good support network of colleagues and administration. Plenty of autonomy and room for creativity.
cons: Salary low for educational level and hours worked, many nights and weekends. Working in satellite offices can mean a lot of travel, depending on the distance from campus.

review_title: A very easy going part-time job
job_title: Community Assistant in Hammond, IN
pros: You get to know new people and it is an easy job. No hard labor and mostly not stressful work. A desk job.
cons: The only complaint or issue I have is that it is minimum wage. I believe that it is worth a bit more since you don't get breaks from your post and responsibility.

review_title: This University is a good place to start your engineer career. High quality courses and full of opportunities.
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in West Lafayette, IN
pros: High quality courses and full of opportunities as long as you try hard to grasp them. Many companies will come to cf to hire new grads.
cons: Well, there's an amount of students who never did any thing during any project and are so annoying. you need to keep yourself really up in order to get rid of those influence.

review_title: Work study is a decent option
job_title: Federal Work Study in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Working in exchange for some extra scholarship money which I could use to pay back my loans or use to live on was nice. Working around class schedules and ensuring I got days off was never a problem.
cons: The specific job I had led to an amount of stress that became intrusive on my studies

job_title: Grad Student in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Nice environment with good opportunities to learn and gain experiences. Good for networking and collaboration with other institutes. Good value for time and money. Low cost of living.
cons: Not the best management at many levels. The plans to stay competitive in the future are not well defined. Small city without much to do.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in West Lafayette, IN
pros: It is a very good experiment to be student stuff in Purdue. I learned not only the knowledge, but also the thinking method to deal with problems. I suggest everyone apply Purdue if possible.
cons: Purdue is in a little town. So it will not be very convenient for shopping and traveling.

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in West Lafayette, IN
pros: It's a good name—for STEM. The job prospects on graduation are pretty good for some of the CLA departments.
cons: Pay for grad teaching "assistants" in the liberal arts is terrible. Plus, we don't really "assist". We teach the classes independently. You're looking at $12,000/year for .5 time (two classes you teach by yourself).

review_title: Great place to work, quiet city for living
job_title: Postdoctoral Research Associate in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Purdue university is a wonderful place for research scientist working there. All of the facilities are convenient for  everyday work and life. You can concentrate on what you like doing without caring about things unrelated to you. The people here are really nice!
cons: The city, West Lafayette, is small. If you prefer amazing entertainment, delicious food, beautiful sight, here would make you a little bit disappointed.

job_title: Web Developer in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Good Environment, clean campus, benefits for full time employees are pretty decent, Coworkers are all good people and for the most part everyone is enjoyable to work with. Always enjoyable when students come back to campus after breaks, lots of life on campus.
cons: Sometimes the faculty look down on the staff like they are of lesser importance. This isn't everyone by any means but I've had a handful of experiences with such individuals.

job_title: Data Analyst in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Great flexibility.  Great Management.  Good benefits and PTO.  Everyone you work with is very nice and most of them have been there long enough to help you with whatever you need.
cons: Mobility.  Most of the lower level management jobs only have a couple of higher up positions before you are stuck in a dead end job.  They then only look to the outside world to fill those higher up positions.

review_title: Lots of opportunities, generally supportive, some troublesome bosses.
job_title: Research Assistant in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Many opportunities, ability to collaborating across offices and disciplines, decent pay for engineering graduate students.
cons: Professors who act irresponsibly as managers are generally not held accountable. It is up to graduate students to identify good candidates for a boss and also their burden to make the case that there is something problematic about a given relationship.

review_title: Graduate Student/ Post Doctoral Research Associate (Organic Chemistry Division)
job_title: Postdoctoral Research Associate in Lafayette, IN
pros: State of the art faculty. State of the art equipment (ex. Bruker 800 MHz TXI probe NMR) the best support staff I've ever seen, NMR, Mass Spec, and AMY Facility. Many professor in the National Academy of Sciences, one Nobel Laureate.
cons: Some of the labs are antiquated depending on the Professor. Once a month paycheck.

job_title: Caterer in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Nice working environment. Supervisors knows well how to face issues that come up with the customers, and they are welcome to always answer your questions. Oh and Free food!
cons: Work load! You would never know  what day and time you are gonna be assigned for the next week until Thursday of this week. So if you have exams or need to prepare for exams, it could get a little difficult in time management

job_title: Graduate Assistant in West Lafayette, IN
pros: If you are looking for a good research school the Purude should rank high. The city of west lafayette has low crime and is peaceful for the most part
cons: Housing is expensive for the area.  Al property is owned by a few leasing companies which creates a monopoly,

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Lafayette, IN
pros: I loved working at Purdue University. It was a great experience that helped me truly educated me, while being able to work in my field that I love. I had a great overall experience that truly let me get my feet wet in the field of communications!
cons: There were literally no cons to this job at all. Everything was great and I loved every day I was able to work with Purdue.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Good increments with experience. Working as a GRA you can get increments in your salary after passing your qualifier exam.
cons: Starting salary quite low, especially in a large department such as mine. The number of GRAs is very high which results in a low starting salary.

job_title: Optics Researcher in West Lafayette, IN
pros: All of the cultural diversity.  There is some of the top technologies being researched at all times, including government research.
cons: The pay isn't that great since it was a research job.  The city also can be pretty dead over the summer, and very cold in the winter.

job_title: Research Assistant in Lafayette, IN
pros: Small town means low cost of living for those on a graduate student's salary. This means that quality of life can be pretty good.
cons: Happiness is usually contingent upon nature of student-advisor relationship. Sometimes this works out really well and sometimes it doesn't. When there is a bad student-advisor relationship, the student is usually powerless.

job_title: Research Assistant in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Very healthy and supportive work environment. Energy and enthusiasm in the air. Good facilities. Easy access to good food and clubs on campus.
cons: Not enough compensation, especially when compared to other Big Ten public schools. Climate can get very cold and rough in winter.

job_title: Associate Director KPDC in Lafayette, IN
pros: As an alum, it is a dream come true to work for this amazing university. At Krannert we boast an outstanding international population and MBA and Masters programs in a wide variety of arenas. Excellent collaboration and forward thinking.
cons: Career Path Progression might be somewhat slower than in industry.

review_title: Great benefits, not so great pay
job_title: Bioanalytical Chemist in West Lafayette, IN
pros:
Benefits (20 days paid vacation each year for admin/professional staff)
Same-sex domestic partner benefits (including, but not limited to, medical coverage)
Flexible work schedules
Cutting edge technology
No room for promotion in current position
cons:
Pay is lower at Purdue than at some other Big 10 universities, lower than in industry
Not much to see/do in West Lafayette, IN
Diversity is lacking at Purdue University, although diversity efforts for African American and LGBT communities is improving

review_title: Graduate recitation instructor for Calc I and II
job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Getting your tuition paid for is the biggest pro of this job.  Hours aren't terrible either as you only have to hold office hours for 4 hours per week.
cons: You have to prepare quizzes for the students twice a week and grade them yourself.  Also sometimes students come to class without questions which makes it tough to gauge where they are having problems.

job_title: Research Assistant in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Efficient pay department, good pay. Place a lot of emphasis on student employment and assistance with their education at the university.
cons: Some jobs pay well over some others - unfair in some situations. Dining courts are the worst places to work at (but the easiest to find a job)

job_title: in Sunnyvale, CA
pros: I think it is very easy for a student to work here. Also working here can show that your are getting involve in the campus. I personally would recommend it.
cons: There is definitely a lot of work. This is my first time being a undergrad TA, and my professor expects a lot out of me. I have to spend a lot of outside class time to do the tasks that were assigned.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Given a lot of time to spend on research projects. Also, the interaction between other graduate students and professors are very helpful.
cons: Very self motivated environment. May have some trouble trying to learn new material out of class

job_title: Research Assistant in Rochester, MN
pros: Very flexible schedule allowing for independent research in a variety of topics. Majority of research is self-guided.
cons: The last two years of my research was done off-campus at a hospital. It's good to be close to the research team but it made it difficult to be so far away from advisors and other professors.

review_title: Great place to work as teaching assistant. I worked there for 3 years and had a good experience for the most part.
job_title: Teaching Assistant in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Friendly staff, good supervisor, mostly smart proactive students. Pay was also decent compared to other part time teaching gigs.
cons: Not many. I would say sometime the students are quite slack in their attitude and would frequently skip class. But that is not on the university.

review_title: Man, no matter the top down BS, you can't beat working in academia
job_title: Computer Technologist in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Good Salary, good benefits, relatively low stress, huge campus - lots to see, many other employees to be social with
cons: Sometimes the directives coming down from the top are pretty stupid. The current hiring process is TERRIBLE. HR has no clue.

review_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Aerospace Engineering
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Wilmington, DE
pros:
Most of tuition and fees are waived
Stipend once a month
cons:
Still paying over $1000 a year towards fees for tuition
Health insurance in non existent if you aren't a 1/2 time employee
1/2 positions rarely given out
Still working roughly 40 hours even if they claim you're only working 10

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in West Lafayette, IN
pros: Time is flexible. Working with students and discuss with them are very enjoyable, especially when they understand them after your instruction
cons: sometimes students drop by at random hours, even though they have been notified that is recommended. Grading might takes sometime, especially when writing is hard to recognise

review_title: Excellent faculty advisors, decent pay grade and long hours.
job_title: Graduate Student in West Lafayette, IN
pros: The pay grade is good for a graduate student, the faculty is helpful and intelligent, and lastly the campus is beautiful.
cons: Depending on your advisor and sponsor, work hours can very high, sometimes over 60 hours a week during the summer.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in West Lafayette, IN
pros: It is challenging. They take care of their employees very well. My professor gave me lots of opportunities to be involved with other projects.
cons: They push you pretty hard but at the same time you are learning a lot more than school work. No much really.

review_title: Truly awful.  They treat their faculty terribly there.
job_title: Assistant Professor of Physics in Hammond, IN
pros: There is no good reason to work specifically at PUC.  It does have some of the general benefits that all professorships have:  flexible schedule, limited supervision, teaching is a rewarding career choice, etc.
cons:
(1) You will get little to no start up funds.  
(2) Promotion and tenure is a total crap-shoot.  They change the rules year to year.  Some people that deserve to get fired get promoted early, people that deserve to get promoted get messed with.  
(3) Annual raises are small, 0 - 2%.  Starting salary is well below that of other similar universities.  
(4) No respect from administration, they regularly renege on their word concerning personal funds, benefits, FTE releases, etc.
(5) Hard work is not respected at PUC, only politicking is.

Working there will be the worst experience of your life.  Almost all of the faculty are demoralized and disgruntled--and with good reason.  It makes for an extremely negative working environment.  Instead of taking their frustrations out on each other (which they do), the faculty should unionize and go on strike.
